newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: FRESH IMPORT PRESSURE PUSHES ZIMBABWE DOLLAR DOWN.
newsitem.headline: FRESH IMPORT PRESSURE PUSHES ZIMBABWE DOLLAR DOWN.

text.p: Import pressure returned to Zimbabwe's interbank market on Wednesday after a two-day lull, pushing the local unit down against hard currencies, exchange dealers said.
"There was heavy importer demand this morning driving our dollar down. If it continues like this we could revisit our all-time low of 10.7600 by the end of the week," said one.
Some dealers said the central Reserve Bank had been rather slow in bailing out the local unit on Wednesday morning, allowing it to lose nine cents within an hour before intervening.
"Sometimes their timing is rather bad but then I wouldn't blame them too much beause there's also an element of speculation in the market," one dealer said.
At around 0740 GMT, the Zimbabwe dollar, which opened at its overnight 10.5300/5500 against the U.S. dollar, was quoted softer at 10.6200/6400.
It also eased against sterling to 16.9560/9920 from 16.8300/8690 and was at 6.9560/9700 versus the mark from 6.8700/8820 at Tuesday's close.
Against South Africa's rand it weakened to 2.3230/3290 from 2.3020/3080. --Stella Mapenzauswa, Harare Newsroom: +263-4 72 52 27/8/9
